item.title: Report E-2024050326
item.description:
Report E-2024050326

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-12
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty (50) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed a neutralizer and then a granular absorbents to the impacted area. The damaged drum and the spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050344
item.description:
Report E-2024050344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2024, one (1) 1,000-pound supersack of UN3077 was torn in transit by a load strap failure and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged supersack and utilized a HEPA vacuum to collect all product. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A HAZMAT LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD. USING THE DECISION TREE, CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHETT AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE AND RELATED SPILL DEBRIS WERE TRANSPORTED TO PSC AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024050341
item.description:
Report E-2024050341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver had a damaged placard on side of trailer and stopped to get it fixed and the shop drilled out the rivet holding the placard on to replace it and drilled through the wall of the trailer and pierced the side of the tote at approximately 1030et. They immediately plugged the hole and a crew was sent out to transfer the material to a new tote to be transported. The material that was released was cleaned up with absorbent and then disposed of properly.

item.title: Report E-2024050307
item.description:
Report E-2024050307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XTO experienced a UN1760 Extreme 184 release from (15) 5-gallon bladder boxes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor and a 10’ x 4’ area of the wood trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged boxes of products were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and an 85-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbents and neutralizer used to clean the release were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050321
item.description:
Report E-2024050321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN2672 Steammate NA1324 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 23' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 25' x 10' area of the concrete lot below. The release was caused by the tote falling on its side as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbent and vinegar were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents were containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
